content:
I think I'll create a separate sheet to track my savings over time. I can set up a table with columns for the date, coupon/discount, savings amount, and total savings. That way, I can easily see how much I've saved over time and identify patterns or trends in my savings.

I might also consider creating a dashboard or summary sheet that provides an overview of my savings progress. I could use charts or graphs to visualize my savings over time, and include metrics like total savings, average savings per month, and percentage of purchases made with coupons.

Using a separate sheet or dashboard will help me stay focused on my savings goals and motivated to continue finding and using coupons. It'll be great to see the impact of my efforts and know that I'm making progress towards saving more money.

By the way, I just thought of something else. I've been using cashback apps like Ibotta and Fetch Rewards to earn money back on my grocery purchases. I should add those to my master
